title: Is it possible to win every lane as every champion, or are some lanes just lost?
body: I've just been wondering if I should focus on getting better around my counters (as If I win lane I usually can get fed) or focus on how to get fed if I lose lane (which happens in about 1 and 3 games I lose lane)

replies.body: Depends on how good you are vs how bad they are. Learning counters is usually better though, as that'll make your laning phase overall better for you.

while some lanes you can win if you are good enough other lanes are just complete loses

Example

{{champion:103}}  players will often freak out if they see {{champion:238}}  but as a ahri player i can tell you that match up is so over hyped and a good ahri player can win it easily if they remember their two core advantages

-Poke range for harass
-Charm to cancel his ult

But if you forget those two things than yeah zed is gonna win it. Other match ups like

{{champion:122}}  vs {{champion:80}} + {{summoner:14}}  than yeah your lane phase is doomed, and unless the pantheon is the worlds biggest fucking idiot. You really have no hope of winning that lane, even if your jungler helps you out, it will be extremely hard to win. The best you can do is get the cs he allows you, roam when you can and make a strategy for when laning phase is over.

There are lanes you're expected to lose that if you don't feed, you out scale and win. 
For example fiora vs pantheon.  Pantheon wins that match up very hard, roams better, but can't keep up with fioras map pressure and kill potential late

No. There are champions that are literally made to cancel out other champion kits. That's the point of league. If you play smart and get help, then yes, every lane is possible to win. In a 1v1 scenario? No. You just just keep playing to your strengths while covering up your weaknesses bit by bit. If you want, you can face your weaknesses head on and play normals till you feel more comfortable.

All in all, league is a very diverse game and things can go any which way.
